intro: Chaerophyllum shahvaricum, commonly known as the Persian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and rocky habitats.
